question: Supreme Court had banned Jallikattu under the:
option1: Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960
option3: Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act, 1999
answer: Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960
explanation: Supreme Court had banned Jallikattu under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960. The Animal Welfare Board of India had given details on the manner in which the bull fight was conducted across Tamil Nadu. The board said that forcing a bull and keeping it in the waiting area for hours and subjecting it to the scorching sun is not for the animal’s well-being. Forcing and pulling the bull by a nose rope into the narrow subjecting it to all forms of torture, fear, pain and suffering.
